active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the pros and cons of automated indicator sharing via AIS compared to manual methods. Consider privacy risks, speed of response, and scalability for non-government entities. Reference real-world examples like phishing campaigns.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in CISA Automated Indicator Sharing (AIS) under Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Threat Intelligence And Hunting > Threat Intelligence Types > 002_Threat Intelligence Sources > Information Sharing Communities > CISA AIS. Generate 25 high-quality Anki-style flashcards optimized for university pedagogy (Bloom's Taxonomy, active learning, scaffolding). Cover these exact learning objectives: [INSERT learning_objectives ARRAY HERE]. Incorporate active learning elements (e.g., scenario prompts) and 4 scaffolding layers: [INSERT scaffolding ARRAY HERE]. Use research context: AIS enables machine-to-machine CTI/IOC sharing via STIX (structure) and TAXII (transport); includes scoring, TLP; open to non-gov; best practices from CISA (https://www.cisa.gov/ais, AIS 2.0 STIX Profile). Address voter priorities: completeness (structured submissions, TLP, scoring), misconceptions, prerequisites (CTI/IOCs), concept map (AIS central: STIX/TAXII/IOCs/TLP). Output ONLY a JSON array of flashcards, each matching this schema: [INSERT flashcard_schema.structure HERE]. Ensure 40% MCQ with distractors per protocol: [INSERT flashcard_schema.distractor_protocol HERE]. Balance: 4-5 per Bloom's level/layer. Explanations must reference objectives, layers, and sources for spaced repetition reinforcement.
